Just go on as if he had just woken from a long sleep.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> OOC: So should I just forget about the Mech girl
> saying she was going to train him, or start from that
> point?
> 
> --- "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>"
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > I did nothing with Owlhawk for the simple reason
> > that either I forgot
> > about it or that I already had eight chars by that
> > time. Either, it
> > doesn't matter. Just start with them at the last
> > base they were in.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "dewboy30816
> > <dewboy30816@y...>"
> > <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > OOC: O.k. this has gone on long enough!  I'm sick
> > and tired of this 
> > > question simply being shrugged off (unless I
> > missed the post in which 
> > > case I apologize)!  Now if you people simply can't
> > remember this 
> > > let's review.  I left a while back.  I said that
> > Cardhead could have 
> > > Flicker, and Winged Warrior could have Owlhawk.  I
> > came back.  
> > > Cardhead told me she couldn't remember where
> > Flicker was, but hadn't 
> > > posted with him in a week so I could take over
> > from whereever I 
> > > wanted too.  Winged Warrior said roughly the same
> > thing about 
> > > Owlhawk, except he failed to mention whether or
> > not he had even used 
> > > Owlhawk, and for that matter if Owlhawk had
> > finished his training 
> > > with the Mech girl.  Now FOR PETE'S SAKE TELL ME!
> > 
> > 
>
